results.content:
I've some experience with NodeJS, Express, MongoDB, Mongoose,
and this course by far contains the worst explanation.

CONS
I enrolled in this particular course just for the CMS Project and expected to learn a bit more which I could use later in my projects.
Thank god I had some prior experience with this stuff before enrolling otherwise I would be confused for a very long period of time.

The thing that I hated the most was jumping around from Frontend to Backend. I mean that's the worst approach to follow. 
The instructor should have stayed with backend up until he finishes it off completely then testing the APIs with Postman or some other client and THEN moved towards Frontend.
I mean Setting up the API and then installing body parser to send body just to check if the API is working? that is absolutely a nightmare! 

PROS
I must say though that the Instructor has good knowledge but the delivery of content is not good, maybe he could have better prepared before and then it would've been a GREAT COURSE. 
There are still a lot of things that I learned from the course.
I would still advise anyone taking the course as you can still learn a lot in between.
But for a Beginner? a BIG NO.

response.content: Thank you for your opinion, Susan!

results.content:
As always, Edwin Dias is one of the best lecturer i have seen on udemy. He is explaining thing very simply so that anyone can understand. 

The way you explain advance stuff, i like it. you start from the beginning and you are giving real world scenarios. That's very important and easy to understand. Also you are not a kind of always serious guy, i mean you are very funny guy. That's made my attraction too for your courses.

One more thing, The support you provide when an error occurred or something not working on my code, that's very supportive. I like very much, Because not all the teachers are provide that kind of support. You or someone professional on Q/A section go through them and point me to the right point.  No matter how many students are in the course, you always help us.

I'm pretty sure i can be professional node developer at the end of this course. As always Thank you so much Edwin, what you do here is very very important than what i pay you. Keep it up.

results.content:
This course does not seem to be for beginners as advertised.

I have only completed a handful of lectures but I am already unable to follow along with the lecturer.  He is using a very advanced IDE which I do not have because he said we could use another, free IDE.  However, there are problems running the example code which he does not deal with at all.

I am not going to carry on with this course as it is not enjoyable at all.  I am going to look for another course on Node which is easier to follow.

This course is really well designed and covers a lot of stuff related to NodeJS and related technologies. It is easy to follow for all types of students. It starts from fundamentals to all the way to advanced concepts.

results.content:
Fantastic course.

Edwin jumps straight into NodeJs. The first third of the course is a primer covering the basics of NodeJs and explaining how to implement Node Package Modules effectively.

In the rest of the course Edwin explains how to build a fully functional Content Management System with all the knowledge explained previously.

Edwin is a very good instructor. He provides all the source code needed. Not only the finished project, but the template files with which to start, meaning a student can jump straight into coding. His lessons are short and concise making it easy for students to start where they left off without confusion. It's very well planned out.

I particularly like his explanations of code and software. Edwin doesn't leave anything unexplained. He's quick and concise. Yet never vague. It's just the right amount of information, giving the student confidence to jump in to the relevant documentation and find out for themselves. Which is a particularly important skill for a student to learn yet next to impossible to teach.

The finished Content Management System provides the perfect foundations to expand upon. Loads could be added and the student should be confident about how they could achieve this on their own.

If there are any problems then the student can be confident that they will get support quickly through the Q&A forums.

I would highly advise that any student thinking of taking this NodeJs course also take Edwin's 'ES6 For Beginners' course. It's free but full of useful information to those who haven't started embracing ES6 yet.

Thanks so much Edwin for providing such a valuable learning experience.
results.content_html:
Fantastic course.

Edwin jumps straight into NodeJs. The first third of the course is a primer covering the basics of NodeJs and explaining how to implement Node Package Modules effectively.

In the rest of the course Edwin explains how to build a fully functional Content Management System with all the knowledge explained previously.

Edwin is a very good instructor. He provides all the source code needed. Not only the finished project, but the template files with which to start, meaning a student can jump straight into coding. His lessons are short and concise making it easy for students to start where they left off without confusion. It's very well planned out.

I particularly like his explanations of code and software. Edwin doesn't leave anything unexplained. He's quick and concise. Yet never vague. It's just the right amount of information, giving the student confidence to jump in to the relevant documentation and find out for themselves. Which is a particularly important skill for a student to learn yet next to impossible to teach.

The finished Content Management System provides the perfect foundations to expand upon. Loads could be added and the student should be confident about how they could achieve this on their own.

If there are any problems then the student can be confident that they will get support quickly through the Q&A forums.

I would highly advise that any student thinking of taking this NodeJs course also take Edwin's 'ES6 For Beginners' course. It's free but full of useful information to those who haven't started embracing ES6 yet.

Thanks so much Edwin for providing such a valuable learning experience.
